Incredients: 1/2kg - Boiled rice(soaked in water for 4 -6 hours)

Steps: Wash and wipe the turmeric leaves to make it dry.
Grind the rice with salt to taste and just add enough water to a fine paste.
Remove the prepared paste and apply evenly on each turmeric leaf.
Mix the filling ingredients.
Place one spoon on top and fold the leaves into half.
Steam them till cooked in an Idli cooker.

Incredients: 1/2kg - Boiled rice, washed and soaked in water for 4 hours

Steps: Wash and wipe the jackfruit leaves
Grind the rice with salt and just enough water to a fine paste
The same covering and filling of turmeric leaf gatti can be used in different ways
Take jackfruit leaves and shape them into cones
Apply paste inside each leaf and fill it with coconut & jaggery mix
then close the top with a little more paste and steam till cooked.
Wash and soak rice for 4-6 hours.
Grind rice, Jackfruit and Jaggery to a fine paste with peppercorns and salt.
Remove and mix with coconut pieces.
Wrap a little of the prepared paste in tekki leaves.
Steam it for 1 hour.

Prepare.Note: If tekki leaves not available, use plantain leaves or idli vessels.

Steps: Wash and soak the rice for 4 to 5 hours
Add a little water and salt
Grind to a fine paste
Cook the mixture over a medium flame in a thick bottomed vessel applied with oil
Stir continously till solid enough to be rolled into balls
Remove from fire and with moistened fingers prepare balls of equal size
Steam till cooked
Press each ball through a semia mould

Prepare.Note: Serve with coconut milk sweetened with jaggery and cardamoms or with Chicken curry.

Incredients: 200gms. - urad daal, wash and soak for 6 hours
1kg. - boiled rice, wash & soak for 4 hours

Steps: Grind urad daal and keep aside
Grind rice finely with coriander seeds, chillies, tamarind, turmeric powder and salt
Finely chop colacasia leaves and and mix well into the rice and urad paste
Put 2 spoonful into a tekki leaves
Cover and steam for 45 minutes
Remove from fire and let it cool
To prepare Gravy: Grind coconut with chillies, coriander seeds and turmeric
Add enough water, salt and 1 chopped onion and keep it to boil
Cut the patrade rolls into 1/2 inch rounds and add to gravy
Boil again for 1 minute
Season with 1 finely chopped onion in ghee or oil

Prepare.Note: Patrade can be eaten without gravy. For that you can cut patrade into 1/2 inch rounds. Fry it on the tava with ghee and its ready to serve hot

Incredients: 1 - cucumber, skinned and cut into pieces
3cups - raw rice, washed and soaked in water for 1 hour

Steps: Grind together rice, coconut, cucumber, little water, salt and jaggery
Batter should be thick
Keep a Idli cooker or Steam vessel(tondoru) on fire
Keep 2 plantain leaves inside the vessel, pour the batter on it
Close the lid and cook for 30 minutes
Pierce with a knife to see if it is cooked
After it becomes cooled, cut into pieces and serve

Prepare.Note: Instead of cucumber, bottleguard can be used.

Steps: Wash and soak raw rice for 2 hours
Grind the rice adding water to a coarse paste
Remove to a vessel, add salt and jaggery, batter should be watery
Keep the vessel on gas, stir well and cook till it becomes thick
After it cooked well add coconut and cardamom powder
Stir and cook for 5 minutes
Take a cup of water, put a little manni on it to test
If it floats on water, then your manni is prepared, off the gas
Take a big plate, place one or two plantain leaves upon it
Apply ghee, pour the prepared manni on it and tap
Let it cool,cut into pieces and serve
Clean and soak Ragi for 8 hours
Grind the ragi with water and seive
Grind the ragi again & again and seive
Add water and make a thin consistency
Keep the vessel on fire
Add salt and jaggery, stir well
Cook till it becomes thick
Add ghee and stir again, cook till the ghee dissolves
Pour to a greased plantain leaf
When it completely cooled cut into pieces

Incredients: 2 - Tender Coconut, grated or extracted milk from tender coconut

Steps: Wash and soak the rise seperately for 4-6 hours
Grind the rice with salt and little water to a thick paste and keep aside
Grind tender coconut with pepper corns, coriander, jeera and oama to a very fine paste
Remove it to a thick bottomed vessel
Batter should be thin consistency
Boil it with salt and jaggery
Place a perforated vessel (Saarne adye kudupu), pour a ladleful of rice paste to a plate and press
Stir gently and cook
Repeat the same process till the rice paste empties
Cook with low flame
Add salt & jaggery if necessary
Add cardamom powder
Fry Cahews and raisins with ghee (optional), add it to the prepared Adye
Wash & soak the rice for 1 1/2 hours
then grind to a very fine paste
Pour into a vessel add salt and water to make a very thin consistency
this dosa batter should be prepared immediately
heat the dosa tava,apply a little oil and take one big spoonful of batter
spread in a thin,even layer
cover and keep it for a second
then remove it caredully
it comes out thin like a handkerchief
serve with chicken curry or red chutney
Wash and soak fenugreek seeds for 5-6 hours and rice for 2 hours
grind grated coconut and fenugreek seeds along with soaked water
then add rice and grind further to a fine paste
remove and mix it well with salt
keep aside for 8 hours
add jaggery and soda,mix well
keep guri appa tava on fire
apply oil,pour batter to all the rounds and cover it
cook both the sides
guri appa tava-special tava with 7 or 11 depressions
Wash and soak rice for 2 hours
drain completely
grind it to a fine paste with tender coconut,cooked rice and salt
batter should be thicker than neer dosa batter
remove from grinder
keep aside for 8hours
heat the dosa tava,apply little oil
pour a big spoonful of batter and spread it in a circle
cover the tava and cook for 1 minute
remove the lid and take out the dosa
repeat for remaining batter
Soak urad daal for 4-5hours
wash and soak raw rice for 2 hours
wash urad daal and grind to a fine paste
add soaked raw rice and grind to a fine paste
pour to a vessel,add salt and mix well
cover and keep aside for 8 hours
heat the dosa tava,apply oil
pour 1big spoonful of batter and spread in a circle
cook for a minute
repeat the remaining batter
urad daal soaked and kept for 4-5 hours
raw rice washed and soaked for 2 hours
wash soaked urad daal and grind to a fine paste
then add coconut, poha and rice
grind to a fine paste
pour it a vessel,add salt and mix well
batter should be of dropping consistency
cover and keep overnight
aapam should be prepared in deep tava
pour 1 big spoonful of batter
slowly  turn the tava round,so that a thin layer forms on the sides and the middle remains thick
cover and cook till done
the middle part will be fluffy and sides thin and crisp
remove and serve
note- without putting soda or yeast aàpam can be done
Wash and soak rice and fenugreek seperately for 5-6 hours
wash poha
mix it with curds and fenugreek seeds and grind to a fine paste
then add rice and grind further to a fine paste
Remove, mix it well with salt
keep aside for 8-9 hours
keep the dosa tava on the fire and rub little oil
take a big spoonful of batter and spread like urad dosa
cook till done
Mix all the ingredients,add water and mix
batter should not be watery
make dosas
serve them with coconut chutney
wash and soak urad daal and rice separately for 5-6 hours
grind the urad daal till very fine
remove and set aside
then grind the rice fine to sooji consistency
remove and mix well with urad daal paste and salt to taste
1/2 tsp.yeast can be added to the batter
cover and keep it for formenting for 8 hours
greese idli cups with little oil
pour the batter in individual cups and steam for 30 minutes
Wash and soak daal and raw rice separately for 4-5 hours
grind the urad dàal to a finé paste
remove it to a big vessel
grind the soaked rice until bàttér is fine to a sooji consistency
remove and mix with urad batter,salt and yeast
mix well
cover and keep for for 8 hours
take four jackfruit leaves
keep them edge to edge and attach with fine sticks in the shape of a cup
fill the cups or gunda with idli batter
steam till cooked
the leaves give a nice flavour to the idli
note:moode is also done in the same way
leaves used here are moode voli or long leaves with thorns
the thorns should be removed and the leaf turned round and shaped like a hollow pipe

Incredients: For potato bhaji - 4-6 - medium size potatoes

Steps: to prepare dosa - wash and soak rice and daals seperately in water for 4-5 hours
then grind together to a fine paste
add salt to the batter which should be of dropping consistency
cover and keep aside for 8 hours
apply oil to the masala dosa tava and keep on fire
when hot sprinkle little water on tava
stir batter and pour a spoonful on tava and spread quickly to make a thin flat round
pour little oil on top
cook it till crisp
put a spoonful of potato bhaji and a lump of butter in the centre of the dosa
fold the dosa
serve hot with chutney
to prepare potato bhaji - boil the potatoes
after it cools,peel the skin and smash into small pieces
heat oil,add mustard seeds
when they splutter add sliced onions,turmeric powder,tomato, ginger and curry leaves
mix and cook
add potatoes and salt
mix and cook for 5 minutes
add coriander leaves and turn off the gas

Incredients: 2 cups - jackfruit (without seeds) cut into pieces

Steps: Wash and soak the rice for 2 hours
Grind the rice with jackfruit,coconut and salt to a fine paste
The batter should be thick
Keep the dosa tava on fire
Apply ghee or oil,pour a big spoonful of batter and spread it a little
cook both the sides
Mix all ingredients with little water, make a thick batter
keep tava on fire,apply little oil,take a handful batter and spread to the tava
cook both the sides

Incredients: For seasoning: 1tsp.-mustard seeds, 1tsp.-urad daal,2 sprig - curry leaves, 1 broken  red chilly,1 tbsp.- coconut oil

Steps: Soak rice for 4 hours
Wash and grind it to a fine paste with just enough water and salt
Remove and mix with coconut
Keep a thick bottomed vessel on fire
add oil,mustard seeds,urad daal,chilly and curry leaves,cook Ground batter over a medium flame,stirring continously,till solid enough to be rolled into balls
Make small lemon sized balls
Steam till cooked(30 minutes)
Fry red chillies,coriander seeds,jeera and methi
Grind along with coconut, turmeric, garlic and tamarind to a fine paste
Remove the masala and cook with salt to taste
add 1 piece of Jaggery
Season with 1tsp.oil,onion and curry leaves
add prepared dumplings,simmer for 1 minute
Remove from fire and serve.
Take a vessel,mix all the ingredients
Make a soft batter and keep aside for 4 hours
Heat the oil in a Kadai,take the batter in hand and slowly drop it to the oil
Deep fry in a low flame
Same way fry all the vadas and serve with coconut chutney and sambar
Peel the skin of bread fruit
Cut into thin long slices,marinate with salt water for 30 minutes
Mix gram flour, salt, chilly powder,turmeric powder,jeera and hing,add little water and make a thick paste
Heat the oil, dip the breadfruit slices in the batter,deep fry in slow flame
Serve hot with chutney or sauce.
Mix together all the ingredients,add little water and make a thick paste
Take a mixture at a time and deep fry in oil till brown and crisp
Serve hot
Note: Cabbage Vada can be made in the same method.
Wash and grind the urad daal to a thick paste
While grinding, add red chillies,ginger and 2 green chillies
Remove and mix with salt,curry leaves and 1 green chilly
Keep enough oil in a Kadai to deep fry vadas
When oil is very hot, take small lumps of paste and form into small balls
Drop into the oil and cook on medium fire until all sides are brown
Remove and serve with chutney and sambar.
Wash and soak the daals for about 2 hours
Then grind the daals together to a very rough paste
Remove and mix together with the other ingredients
Take a little of the mixture and flattern into rounds and deep fry in oil until brown
Serve with chutney.
Boil ,peel and mash the potatoes
Add salt,chopped green chillies,ginger,garlic,curry leaves and corianderleaves
Mix well,Form into small vadas and keep aside
Take besan,chilly powder and a pinch of salt
Mix with water and make a thixk batter
Dip the vadas in this batter and deep fry in hot oil
Serve with chutney.
Take a vessel,mix all the ingredients
Make a soft batter and keep aside for 4 hours
Heat the oil in a Kadai,take the batter in hand and slowly drop it to the oil
Deep fry in a low flame
Same way fry all the vadas and serve with coconut chutney and sambar
Take a vessel,mix all the ingredients
Make a soft batter and keep aside for 4 hours
Heat the oil in a Kadai,take the batter in hand and slowly drop it to the oil
Deep fry in a low flame
Same way fry all the vadas and serve with coconut chutney and sambar
Grind all the ingredients to a coarse rough paste with a little water.
Season with oil,mustard seeds,urad daal,red chilly and curry leaves.
Fry oil in small pan with mustard seeds,red chillies, crushed garlic and curry leaves
Grind with coconut, salt and tamarind, add little water
Method.Note: Note: Serve with Dosa,Apaam and Idli

Steps: Fry mustard seeds,red chillies, crushed garlic and curry leaves with oil
Grind all the ingredients with tamarind and salt to a rough paste
Peel the skin of raw mango
cut into pieces
grind with the ingredients
Peel the skin of mangoes
cut into pieces
keep in a bowl
Grind the other ingredient and mix it with mango pieces
Heat oil in a Kadai
Fry red chillies,curry leaves and coconut
Grind it with tamarind and salt,don't add water(dry)
put it in a clean bottle
can be stored for many days
cook the chopped ridgegourd gourd skins in a cup of water
drain the water
grind together all the inhredients
Season with oil,mustard seeds,red chilly (broken) and curry leaves

Incredients: 1 1/2 cups- Brahmi leaves with roots cleaned properly  and chopped
Tamarind ( size of a small lime)

Steps: Grind the ingredients all together to a fine thick paste
Note: Good for memory.

Incredients: Tamarind - size of its seed or juice of a lemon

Steps: Grind all ingredients together without water yo a rough paste
Serve with dosa.
Grind all ingredients together to a fine paste,without water
Note: After taking the mint leaves from the plant,keep the plants in a glass of water for 5 to 7 days
It starts growing
Plant it in a pot
It needs much water.
Fry oil and add Mustard Seeds in a pan.
When they splutter add finely chopped Onion, turmeric powder, green chillies, crushed garlic and curry leaves.
When it turns brown, add fine chopped tomatoes (smashed tamrind water if needed), piece of ginger.
Add salt to taste.
Then add 4 Glasses of water and leave it to boil.
After it cooked garnish with chopped coriander leaves.
Grind together the ingredients to a fine paste.
Fry oil in vessel.
Add Mustard seeds when they splutter, add curry leaves then add the ground masala.
Add pinch of Turmeric Powder.
Add salt to taste.
Add red chilly powder, 1 tea spoon of garam masala which gives good aroma.
Leave it to boil.
Garnish with coriander leaves
Grind the ingredients to a fine paste.
Cook 2-3 finally chopped tomatoes with water.
Add salt to taste.
1 Teaspoon turmeric powder.
After the tomato cooked add ground masala and boil for 10-15 minutes.
Add finely chopped coriander leaves.
Season with 1 spoon ghee or oil, mustard, curry leaves, 3-4 flakes of crushed garlic.
Boil the daal in 2-3 cups of water until well cooked,beat it well and keep aside
Boil the tomato with 1 cup water,tamarind and salt until cooked.
add the powdered peppercorns,crushed garlic and turmeric powder and boil
Pour the cooked daal over it and remove
Season with coconut oil,mustard seeds,broken red chilly and curry leaves to a fine paste.
Cook 2-3 finally chopped tomatoes with water.
Add salt to taste.
1 Teaspoon turmeric powder.
After the tomato cooked add ground masala and boil for 10-15 minutes.
Add finely chopped coriander leaves.
Season with 1 spoon ghee or oil, mustard, curry leaves, 3-4 flakes of crushed garlic.

Incredients: 1 cup toordaal washed & soaked in water for 1/2 to 1 hour

Steps: Cook the daal in 3 to 4 cups water until soft
Mix it well
add chopped tomatoes,green chillies,finely chopped ginger, sliced onion,turmeric powder,asafoetida powder and salt to taste
boil until cooked
Add finely chopped coriander leaves.
Season with oil,mustard seeds,curry leaves and broken red chilly
Keep a Kadai on fire,Fry all the masala ingredients separately with little oil
grind to a rough pastete,add little water
Boil the toor daal with 3-4 cups of water
add the cut vegetables
add salt and cook
add the ground masala and cook for 10-15 minutes
season with ghee or oil,mustard seeds and curry leaves
Grind together the masala ingredients to a coarse paste
Boil the daal in 1 cup of water
Cook the cucumber with onions,tamarind, tomato,salt and asfoetida powder
add the cooked daal to the vegetable mixture
add the ground masala and boil for 10-15 minutes
Season with coconut oil,mustard seeds, broken red chilly and curry leaves
Peel the skin of mangoes and squeeze out the juice from the skin
add it to the mango
put water and cook
add sliced green chillies,onion,chilly powder,salt and jaggery
Season with mustard seeds,crushed garlic flakes,broken chilly and curry leavestep5
Roast all the masala ingredients separately with little oil and powdwr them
Put some water on the mango skins and squeeze out the juice
Mix this with water with mango,roasted powdered masala, jaggery,and salt
cook for 10-15 minutes,stirring contnously
Season with oil,mustard seeds,curry leaves and broken red chilly

Incredients: tamarind -size of 2 limes soaked in water

Steps: Grind together masala ingredients to a fine paste.
Boil the horsegram with 7-8 cups of water,until well cooked.
Drain and take away the residue of the horsegram
Add the ground masala,tamarind water,salt and boil for 15 minutes
Season with oil,mustard seeds,broken red chilly,crushed garlic and curry leaves.
Cook Bengal gram and tendli in just enough water with salt
Grind the masala ingredients together to a fine paste
Then add coconut and grind to a coarse paste
Fry a pan with oil,mustard seeds,sliced onion,crushed 4 flakes of garlic,curry leaves,1spoon urad daal
Fry the ground masala
after its raw smell goes,add cooked Bengal gram & tendli,mix it well
cover the lid and cook for 5 minutes
Note-same type of sukka can be prepared with different combination-Bengal gram & Raw Jackfruit, Bengal gram & Yam
Peel off the outer skin of the plantain stem and cut into round pieces
Then cut each round into small pieces
the loose fibres obtained after each slice is cut should be discarded
boil in very little water with salt till tender
Grind together masala ingredients except coconut to a fine paste
add scraped coconut and grind to a coarse paste
add it to the cooked plantain stem
cook it for 10 to 15 minutes on a slow fire
season with oil,mustard seeds, curry leaves and crushed garlic.
Grind all the masala except coconut to fine paste
add grated coconut and grind to a coarse paste
keep aside
remove the flowers and leaves of plantain bud
cut the white part into small pieces, wash and cook
drain the water and keep aside
fry a pan with oil,mustard,sliced onion,1 broken chilly, 4 crushed garlic flakes, 2 sprig curry leaves
add the ground masala, fry till the raw smell goes
add salt and Jaggery
add cooked plantain flower bud,mix it and cook for 5 minutes.

Incredients: 1/4 kg raw jackfruit,cut and soaked in salt water

Steps: Grind together maaala ingredients except coconut to a fine paste
add the coconut and grind to a coarse paste
remove and set aside
take out the jackfruit pieces from the salt water
cut into strips and put in fresh water
Heat oil and add mustard seeds
when they splutter add sliced onion,curry leaves and crushed garlic flakes
when onion turns brown add jackfruit slices,add 2 cups of water
boil till it cooked
add the ground masala and salt
cook it for 10-15 minutes
Grind together masala ingredients except coconut to a fine paste
add coconut and grind further to a coarse paste
remove and keep it aside
take out thick outer skin of jackfruit
cut into small pieces and put it in water
remove from water and cook it with enough water,salt and jaggery
when it is cooked drain the remained water
add the ground masala and cook for another 10 minutes
season with coconut oil, mustard seeds,finely chopped onion,curry leaves,urad daal,1 broken red chilly

Incredients: 4-raw bananas(skinned and cut into medium pieces and soaked in water)

Steps: Cook the banana pieces in tamarind water,salt and 2 cups water
grind together the masala ingredients except coconut to a fine paste
then add coconut and grind to a coarse paste
remove and keep aside
Keep oil on fire
add mustard seeds
when they splutter,add curry leaves,broken red chilly
then add ground masala,cook for 10 minutes
drain water from cooked raw banana then add to the masala
mix it,cook for 5 minutes
Keep oil in a pan
add mustard seeds,sliced onion,green chillies,channa daal,turmeric powder and curry leaves
when all well fried,add beans and little water
when beans cooked add salt to taste,grated coconut and mix it well
cook for 5 minutes
Peel off the skin of Ridgegourd
wash & cut into small pieces
Heat oil on Kadai,add mustard seeds
when they splutter,add sliced onion,green chillies,garlic,curry leaves,mix and add ridgegourd pieces
add salt
add very little water,Cook on slow fire till done
add scraped coconut before removing from fire
Note: Upkari can also be prepared with cabbage,potatoes,French beans,and,snake gourd

Incredients: 1 small or medium size - Cucumber (cut into medium pieces without removing skin)

Steps: Grind all the masala ingredients except jaggery and salt to a fine paste
Keep the cucumber in a vessel to boil with 3-4 cups of water,salt and Jaggery
When it is cooked,add ground masala and cook for some more time
Season it with oil,mustard seeds,1 broken red chilly, crushed garlic and curry leaves.
Wash the Bengal gram and cook it with water,onion and salt
Add hing
Grind all the masala ingredients together until fine
Add it to the cooked gram and boil for 5-10 minutes
The curry should be thick in consistency
Keep oil in a small pan and place on fire
Add mustard seeds,when they splutter, add finely chopped onion,fry till brown,add curry leaves
Add it to the cooked gram.
Soak Green gram for 6 hours
Wash & drain water and keep it for 8 hours
It starts sprouting
Keep it on fire, add water and cook
After it cooked,add salt,chopped onion and tomato
Grind all the masala ingredients to a fine paste
Add it to the cooked gram
Curry should be thick in consistency
Boil for 5-10 minutes
Season with oil,mustard seeds,finely chopped onion,1 broken red chilly,crushed garlic flakes and curry leaves.

Incredients: Tamarind - size of a big lemon,soaked in water

Steps: Skin,wash and cut the drumsticks into 3-4 inch long pieces
Remove the brinjal pieces from water
Cook them with tamarind water,then add drumsticks,salt and jaggery
Grind all the masala ingredients together to a fine paste
Add it to the cooked vegetables and boil for 10 minutes
Season with coconut oil, mustard seeds, broken red chilly and crushed garlic flakes and curry leaves

Incredients: 1/4kg - Brinjal, cut and soaked in water
Tamarind - size of a big lime,soaked in water
Jaggery - size of a small lime

Steps: Boil the cut brinjal with tamarind water,jaggery and salt
Keep aside
Keep oil in the Kadai on fire
Add mustard seeds
When they splutter,add urad daal,crushed garlic and curry leaves
Add *Masala chilly powder
Fry for a minute
Pour the cooked brinjal into it,cover and simmer for 5 minutes
*Maaala Chilly Powder: 7-8 - Red Chillies,1 tbsp.- Coriander seeds,1/2 tsp. - Cumin seeds,1/2tsp.- fenugreek seeds,1/2 tsp.- Urad daal
Kundapur Masala Powder can be used in place of the above  masala.
Roast and grind all the above ingredients except garlic which has to be added last without peeling the skin
Cool and store in an air tight container
This Masala powder can be used for Chicken, Mutton,Vegetables or Eggs
Note:Roast every item separately on very slow fire.

Incredients: 1/2kg - White Pumpkin (skinned and cut into small pieces)
Tamarind - size of a small lime

Steps: Keep the pumpkin pieces for boiling with 3 cups of water,green chillies,tamarind and salt
Boil till cooked
Grind the coconut with jeera to a fine paste
Add it to the cooked pumpkin and boil for 10-15 minutes
Add buttermilk and remove from fire
Season with coconut oil, mustard seeds,curry leaves and broken red chilly.
Grind all the masala ingredients together until fine
Cook Spinach and the horse gram with salt
After it cooked, Add the ground masala and boil for 10 minutes
Season with oil,mustard seeds, broken red chilly and curry leaves.
